summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 5899, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Irving Street, in the City of Seattle, from a point two hundred and eighty (280) feet east of Twenty-fourth Avenue South to Bradner Place, by constructing along said portions of said streets and ironstone pipe sewer of proper dimensions with all necessary manholes openings, wyes, ventilators, catch basins and flush tanks, and by constructing same with the main sewer crossing Irving Street east of Twenty-sixth Avenue South, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
